pyinterpolate.processing.preprocessing package#

Submodules#

pyinterpolate.processing.preprocessing.blocks module#

Core data structures for block interpolation.

Authors#

  1. Szymon Moli≈Ñski | @SimonMolinsky

class Blocks[source]#

Bases: object

Class stores and prepares aggregated data.

Variables:

  • data (gpd.GeoDataFrame) ‚Äì Dataset with block values.

  • value_column_name (Any) ‚Äì Name of the column with block rates.

  • geometry_column_name (Any) ‚Äì Name of the column with a block geometry.

  • index_column_name (Any) ‚Äì Name of the column with the index.

from_file(fpath, value_col, geometry_col, index_col)[source]#

Reads and parses data from spatial file supported by GeoPandas.

from_geodataframe(gdf, value_col, geometry_col, use_index)[source]#

Reads and parses data from GeoPandas GeoDataFrame.

Examples

>>> geocls = Blocks()
>>> geocls.from_file('testfile.shp', value_col='val', geometry_col='geometry', index_col='idx')
>>> parsed_columns = geocls.data.columns
>>> print(list(parsed_columns))
(idx, val, geometry, centroid.x, centroid.y)
from_file(fpath: str, value_col, geometry_col='geometry', index_col=None, layer_name=None)[source]#

Loads areal dataset from a file supported by GeoPandas.

Parameters:

  • fpath (str) ‚Äì Path to the spatial file.

  • value_col (Any) ‚Äì The name of a column with values.

  • geometry_col (default=‚Äôgeometry‚Äô) ‚Äì The name of a column with blocks.

  • index_col (default = None) ‚Äì Index column name. It could be any unique value from a dataset. If not given then index is taken from the index array of GeoDataFrame and it is named ‚Äòindex‚Äô.

  • layer_name (Any, Optional) ‚Äì The name of a layer with data if provided input is a gpkg file.

Raises:

IndexColNotUniqueError ‚Äì Raised when given index column is not unique.

from_geodataframe(gdf: GeoDataFrame, value_col, geometry_col='geometry', index_col=None)[source]#

Loads areal dataset from a GeoDataFrame supported by GeoPandas.

Parameters:

  • gdf (gpd.GeoDataFrame)

  • value_col (Any) ‚Äì The name of a column with values.

  • geometry_col (Any, default = ‚Äògeometry‚Äô) ‚Äì The name of a column with blocks.

  • index_col (Any, default = None) ‚Äì If set then a specific column is treated as an index.

Raises:

IndexColNotUniqueError ‚Äì Given index column values are not unique.

set_names(val_col, geom_col, idx_col)[source]#
class PointSupport[source]#

Bases: object

Class prepares the point support data in relation to block dataset.

Variables:

point_support (gpd.GeoDataFrame) ‚Äì Dataset with point support values and indexes of blocks (where point falls into).

from_files()[source]#

Loads point support and polygon data from files.

from_geodataframes()[source]#

Loads point support and polygon data from dataframe.

Notes

TODO: info about regualarization process

Examples

import geopandas as gpd from pyinterpolate.processing.point.structure import PointSupport

POPULATION_DATA = ‚Äúpath to the point support file‚Äù POLYGON_DATA = ‚Äúpath to the polygon data‚Äù GEOMETRY_COL = ‚Äúgeometry‚Äù POP10 = ‚ÄúPOP10‚Äù POLYGON_ID = ‚ÄúFIPS‚Äù

gdf_points = gpd.read_file(POPULATION_DATA) gdf_polygons = gpd.read_file(POLYGON_DATA) point_support = PointSupport() out = point_support.from_geodataframes(gdf_points,

gdf_polygons, point_support_geometry_col=GEOMETRY_COL, point_support_val_col=POP10, blocks_geometry_col=GEOMETRY_COL, blocks_index_col=POLYGON_ID)

from_files(point_support_data_file: str, blocks_file: str, point_support_geometry_col, point_support_val_col, blocks_geometry_col, blocks_index_col, use_point_support_crs: bool = True, point_support_layer_name=None, blocks_layer_name=None)[source]#

Methods prepares the point support data from files.

Parameters:

  • point_support_data_file (str) ‚Äì Path to the file with point support data. Reads all files processed by the GeoPandas.

  • blocks_file (str) ‚Äì Path to the file with polygon data. Reads all files processed by GeoPandas.

  • point_support_geometry_col (Any) ‚Äì The name of the point support geometry column.

  • point_support_val_col (Any) ‚Äì The name of the point support column with values.

  • blocks_geometry_col (Any) ‚Äì The name of the polygon geometry column.

  • blocks_index_col (Any) ‚Äì The name of polygon‚Äôs index column (must be unique!).

  • use_point_support_crs (bool, default = True) ‚Äì If set to False then the point support crs is transformed to the same crs as polygon dataset.

  • point_support_layer_name (Any, default = None) ‚Äì If provided file is .gpkg then this parameter must be provided.

  • blocks_layer_name (Any, default = None) ‚Äì If provided file is .gpkg then this parameter must be provided.

from_geodataframes(point_support_dataframe: Union[GeoDataFrame, GeoSeries], blocks_dataframe: GeoDataFrame, point_support_geometry_col, point_support_val_col, blocks_geometry_col, blocks_index_col, use_point_support_crs: bool = True)[source]#

Methods prepares the point support data from files.

Parameters:

point_support_dataframe (GeoDataFrame or GeoSeries)

blocks_dataframeGeoDataFrame

Block data with block indexes and geometries.

point_support_geometry_colAny

The name of the point support geometry column.

point_support_val_colAny

The name of the point support column with values.

point_support_val_colAny

The name of the point support column with values.

blocks_geometry_colAny

The name of the polygon geometry column.

blocks_index_colAny

The name of polygon‚Äôs index column (must be unique!).

use_point_support_crsbool, default = True

If set to False then the point support crs is transformed to the same crs as polygon dataset.
